programme.title: Michael Youssef
programme.desc: Dr Michael Youssef preaches spiritual advice and provides biblical clarity to today's social and political issues.

programme.title: Harvest With Pastor Greg Laurie
programme.desc: A cinematic crusade that addresses life's deepest questions: Why am I here? What happens after I die? And, is there hope for today?

programme.title: Amazing Facts
programme.desc: Pastor Doug Batchelor reveals "Amazing Facts" of biblical events and brings new insight to frequently asked questions in Christian faith.

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: Showing compassion to others who are hurting; blessing others with empathy and concern.

programme.title: Joel Osteen
programme.desc: Author and evangelist Joel Osteen spreads his message of love and hope as he preaches at the 30,000-plus member Lakewood Church in Houston. The program can be seen in more than 100 countries. Osteen urges people to live at their full potential and form a close relationship with God.

programme.title: The PiYo Craze from Beachbody!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga, and fluid motion all-in-one!

programme.title: Obsession: Stalked by My Lover
programme.desc: A woman's romantic relationship with her new roommate turns treacherous when he hatches a scheme to steal money from her wealthy sister.

programme.title: Obsession: Escaping My Ex
programme.desc: Madison Turner must fight for her life when the man who betrayed her escapes from a prison van and holds her captive.

programme.title: Kept Woman
programme.desc: A man (Shaun Benson) lures his new neighbor (Courtney Ford) into his house, then holds her captive in a secret bunker with another woman (Rachel Wilson).

programme.title: Lust: A Seven Deadly Sins Story
programme.desc: Tiffanie Cooper is about to marry the dashing Damon King, the man of her dreams and founder of King Enterprises. However, her future soon takes an uncertain turn when Damon's shady best man triggers a passion within her that she never expected.

programme.title: Envy: A Seven Deadly Sins Story
programme.desc: Gabrielle seems to have it all -- a devoted husband, a beautiful daughter and a successful career in public relations. However, she soon stands to lose everything when she meets Keisha, her devious half sister who wants everything Gabrielle has.

programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
programme.desc: Lionel Essrog is a lonely private detective who doesn't let Tourette's syndrome stand in the way of his job. Gifted with a few clues and an obsessive mind, Lionel sets out to solve the murder of Frank Minna -- his mentor and only friend. Scouring the jazz clubs and slums of Brooklyn and Harlem, Essrog soon uncovers a web of secrets while contending with thugs, corruption and the most dangerous man in the city.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Twelve strangers wake up in a clearing. They don't know where they are -- or how they got there. In the shadow of a dark internet conspiracy theory, ruthless elitists gather at a remote location to hunt humans for sport. But their master plan is about to be derailed when one of the hunted, Crystal, turns the tables on her pursuers.

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: A teenage hacker finds himself framed for the theft of millions of dollars from a major corporation. Master hacker Dade Murphy, aka Zero Cool, aka Crash Override, has been banned from touching a keyboard for seven years after crashing over 1,500 Wall Street computers at the age of 11. Now keen to get back in front of a monitor, he finds himself in more trouble than ever.

programme.title: Bordertown
programme.desc: Lauren Adrian (Jennifer Lopez), a Chicago reporter, travels to Mexico to investigate the unsolved murders of hundreds of Mexican women taking place over the years near an American-owned factory. Lauren reunites with Alfonso Diaz (Antonio Banderas), her former lover and colleague, who publicizes the murders despite threats from local authorities. Together the pair seek the truth and try to help the survivor (Maya Zapata) of a brutal attack find justice.

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul
programme.desc: Abdul Karim arrives from India to participate in Queen Victoria's golden jubilee. The young clerk is surprised to find favor with the queen herself. As Victoria questions the constrictions of her long-held position, the two forge an unlikely and devoted alliance that her household and inner circle try to destroy. As their friendship deepens, the queen begins to see a changing world through new eyes, joyfully reclaiming her humanity.

programme.title: Stand and Deliver
programme.desc: Los Angeles high school teacher Jaime Escalante (Edward James Olmos) is being hassled by tough students like Angel Guzman (Lou Diamond Phillips). But Jaime is also pressured by his bosses, who want him to control his raucous classroom. Caught in the middle, he opts to immerse his students in higher math. After intensive study, his students ace California's calculus test, only to learn that their scores are being questioned. They'll have to retake the exam in order to quiet the critics.

programme.title: Army of Darkness
programme.desc: 3rd Evil Dead movie. Ash (Bruce Campbell) finds himself trapped in medieval times. He must quest for the Necronomicon, a book of evil which can return him to his time. Unfortunately, he releases the evil trapped inside the book and unleashes an army of the dead.

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: Detective Rick Santoro (Nicolas Cage) has never played by the rules. When he attends a high-profile boxing match with his friend Navy Cmdr. Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), as well as Defense Secretary Kirkland (Joel Fabiani), he witnesses a terrorist assassinate Kirkland. Despite a lockdown on the arena, key witness Julia Costello (Carla Gugino) escapes -- and Santoro begins to suspect Kirkland's death is part of a much larger conspiracy that involves boxing rivals and a beautiful stranger.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Amsterdam Vallon (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a young Irish immigrant released from prison. He returns to the Five Points seeking revenge against his father's killer, William Cutting (Daniel Day-Lewis), a powerful anti-immigrant gang leader. He knows that revenge can only be attained by infiltrating Cutting's inner circle. Amsterdam's journey becomes a fight for personal survival and to find a place for the Irish people in 1860's New York.

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In 1820, crewmen (Chris Hemsworth, Benjamin Walker, Cillian Murphy) aboard the New England vessel Essex face a harrowing battle for survival when a whale of mammoth size and strength attacks with force, crippling their ship and leaving them adrift in the ocean. Pushed to their limits and facing storms, starvation, panic and despair, the survivors must resort to the unthinkable to stay alive. Their incredible tale ultimately inspires author Herman Melville to write "Moby-Dick."

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: David Dunn (Bruce Willis) is the sole survivor of a devastating train wreck. Elijah Price (Samuel L. Jackson) is a mysterious stranger who offers a bizarre explanation as to why David escaped without a single scratch -- an explanation which threatens to change David's family and his life forever.

programme.title: The Good Lie
programme.desc: After their village is destroyed and their parents killed by Northern militia, Sudanese orphans Theo, his siblings and other survivors make a difficult journey to a refugee camp in Kenya. Thirteen years later, the group gets the chance to settle in the U.S. They are met in Kansas by Carrie Davis (Reese Witherspoon), who has been charged with finding them jobs. However, seeing how adrift they are in 20th-century America, Carrie endeavors to help them in rebuilding their shattered lives.

programme.title: The Devil Inside
programme.desc: Twenty years after Maria Rossi (Suzan Crowley) murdered three people, her daughter, Isabella (Fernanda Andrade), seeks the truth about that terrible night. Isabella travels to an Italian hospital for the criminally insane -- where Maria is locked away -- to find out whether her mother is mentally ill or demonically possessed. With the help of two young exorcists (Simon Quarterman, Evan Helmuth), Isabella tries to cure Maria -- and engages four demons in a battle for her mother's soul.

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Following the assassination of President Lincoln, seven men and one woman are arrested and charged with conspiring to kill Lincoln, the vice president and the secretary of state. Lawyer Frederick Aiken (James McAvoy) reluctantly agrees to defend the lone woman, Mary Surratt (Robin Wright), who owns a boarding house where John Wilkes Booth and others met to plan their crimes. Aiken realizes that Mary may be innocent and being used as bait to capture her son, a suspect who is still at large.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Charged with the most important assignment of his career, federal agent Ron Fleury (Jamie Foxx) has one week to assemble a team, infiltrate and destroy a terrorist cell based in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Culture shock and opposition from local law enforcement combine to hinder his progress and that of his elite team (Chris Cooper, Jennifer Garner, Jason Bateman), but a sympathetic Saudi police captain becomes an unexpected comrade-in-arms.

programme.title: Doctor Sleep
programme.desc: Struggling with alcoholism, Dan Torrance remains traumatized by the sinister events that occurred at the Overlook Hotel when he was a child. His hope for a peaceful existence soon becomes shattered when he meets Abra, a teen who shares his extrasensory gift of the "shine." Together, they form an unlikely alliance to battle the True Knot, a cult whose members try to feed off the shine of innocents to become immortal.

programme.title: In Secret
programme.desc: A woman (Elizabeth Olsen) and her lover (Oscar Isaac) conspire to murder her mild-mannered husband (Tom Felton), but overwhelming guilt soon turns their passion into hatred.

programme.title: The Invisible
programme.desc: Nick Powell (Justin Chatwin), a promising young writer, is the victim of a violent attack, then is left for dead. He hovers in a realm between life and death, and the living cannot see him. Nick must unravel the mystery of what happened to him before time runs out and he is lost forever.

programme.title: Cousins
programme.desc: In this American remake of the popular French romantic comedy "Cousin Cousine," Larry (Ted Danson) and Maria (Isabella Rossellini) meet at the wedding of Larry's uncle to Maria's mother. At the reception, the newly minted cousins realize that Larry's wife, Tish (Sean Young), has been having an affair with Maria's husband, Tom (William Petersen). Bonding over their shared outrage at their spouses' behavior, they decide to pretend that they're having an affair as well.

programme.title: Harriet
programme.desc: From her escape from slavery through the dangerous missions she led to liberate hundreds of slaves through the Underground Railroad, the story of heroic abolitionist Harriet Tubman is told.

programme.title: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Some British retirees (Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, Bill Nighy) decide to outsource their retirement to exotic -- and less expensive -- India. Lured by advertisements for the newly restored Marigold Hotel and imagining a life of leisure in lush surroundings, they arrive and find that the Marigold is actually a shell of its former self. Though their new home is not quite what they had imagined, the retirees find that life and love can begin again when they let go of their pasts.

programme.title: In Good Company
programme.desc: After years of working as an ad executive at a sports magazine, Dan Foreman (Dennis Quaid) is demoted and replaced with Carter Duryea (Topher Grace), a rising star in the business world who is young enough to be Dan's son. Carter's business style leaves Dan shaking his head and wondering if the young man is ready for the corporate world. Dan's life is further complicated when he learns his wife is pregnant and Carter is dating his daughter, Alex (Scarlett Johansson).

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick (Jason Bateman), Dale (Charlie Day) and Kurt (Jason Sudeikis) are workers who would like nothing better than to grind their oppressive employers into the dirt. Quitting their jobs is not an option, so -- fueled by alcohol and dubious advice from a criminal (Jamie Foxx) -- the men devise a complex and seemingly foolproof plan to permanently rid themselves of their terrible bosses. The problem is, any plan is only as clever as the brains behind it.

programme.title: They Came Together
programme.desc: The owner (Amy Poehler) of an independent candy shop and the corporate stooge (Paul Rudd) who has been sent to shut her down begin an unlikely romance.

programme.title: Equilibrium
programme.desc: In a futuristic world, a regime has eliminated war by suppressing emotions: books, art and music are strictly forbidden and feeling is a crime punishable by death. Clerick John Preston (Christian Bale) is a top-ranking government agent responsible for destroying those who resist these rules. When he misses a dose of Prozium, a mind-altering drug that hinders emotion, Preston, who has been trained to enforce strict laws of the new regime, suddenly becomes the one capable of overthrowing it.

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: In 1993, a freak accident involving a noose kills teenager Charlie Grimille during a high-school production of "The Gallows." Twenty years later, on the eve of the play's revival, students Reese (Reese Mishler), Pfeifer (Pfeifer Brown), Ryan (Ryan Shoos) and Cassidy become trapped in the auditorium, with no way of calling for help. A night of terror awaits the four friends as they face the wrath of a malevolent and vengeful spirit. It seems Charlie will have his curtain call after all.

programme.title: Darkness
programme.desc: Paul (Stephan Enquist) and his older sister, Regina (Anna Paquin), unpack and settle into their new country home with their mother (Lena Olin) and father (Iain Glen). An atmosphere of dread slowly becomes evident in the house, and, before long, strange things are happening within its walls. As the supernatural occurrences get more intense and threatening, Regina looks into the house's dark history and struggles to uncover the reason behind the macabre presence.

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia (Jennifer Connelly) wants to move away from her ex-husband, Kyle (Dougray Scott), and take her daughter, Ceci (Ariel Gade), with her. Relocating to a dreary tower block, Dahlia and Ceci discover eerie, dark water leaking through the ceiling of their new apartment. Dahlia petitions the supervisor (Pete Postlethwaite) and the building's owner (John C. Reilly) to fix the leak, yet it only gets worse. Now having nightmares about the dripping, Dahlia is driven to confront the problem herself.

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: When the Event Horizon, a spacecraft that vanished years earlier, suddenly reappears, a team is dispatched to investigate the ship. Accompanied by the Event Horizon's creator, William Weir (Sam Neill), the crew of the Lewis and Clark, led by Capt. Miller (Laurence Fishburne), begins to explore the seemingly abandoned vessel. However, it soon becomes evident that something sinister resides in its corridors, and that the horrors that befell the Event Horizon's previous journey are still present.

programme.title: Gamer
programme.desc: Each week Kable (Gerard Butler), a death-row inmate, battles his fellow prisoners in a violent online game called "Slayers," his every move controlled by a young gamer's remote device. To the players, Kable and the other inmates are just simulated characters. But, to a resistance group that opposes the game's inventor, Kable is a critical component of their plan to end the inventor's form of high-tech slavery.

programme.title: Impostor
programme.desc: Spencer Olham (Gary Sinise) had a perfect life: a loving family and a beautiful wife (Madeleine Stowe). On Tuesday evening he went to bed an acclaimed and well-respected scientist. On Wednesday morning, he woke up public enemy number-one. Now Spencer has to do everything in his power to prove his innocence in a future where nothing is as it seems and paranoia is everywhere.

programme.title: Words and Pictures
programme.desc: An art teacher and English teacher have a competition and allow students to vote on the importance of words and pictures.

programme.title: El Norte
programme.desc: When a group of Mayan Indians decides to organize a labor union to improve conditions in their village, their community is violently destroyed by the Guatemalan army. Teenage siblings, Rosa (Zaide Silvia Gutiérrez) and Enrique (David Villalpando) manage to escape the massacre and decide to start a new life in El Norte -- the USA. The two trek through Mexico, meeting a variety of characters and facing trials and tribulations on their journey toward lives as illegal immigrants in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: During a special forces operation to prevent a Vietnamese general from purchasing nuclear triggers, Mike Weston's (Thomas Ian Griffith) partner, Jones (Chris Mulkey), is taken hostage. Mike escapes with the triggers and quits the Army. A year later, he learns Jones is still a prisoner in the jungle and decides to cooperate with the Army on a mission to rescue his friend. After arriving in Vietnam disguised as a tourist, Mike is captured by the general's men and taken to the prison camp.

programme.title: The Recruit
programme.desc: In an era when the country's first line of defense - human intelligence - is more important than ever, comes an explosive thriller that gives an insider's view into the CIA's secret training ground: The Farm. James Clayton (Colin Farrell) might not have the attitude of a typical recruit, but he is one of the smartest graduating seniors in the country -- and he's just the person that Walter Burke (Al Pacino) wants in the Agency.

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: To be young and carefree amid the blue waters and idyllic landscape of sun-drenched Italy in the late 1950s; that's la dolce vita Tom Ripley (Matt Damon) craves- and Dickie Greenleaf (Jude Law) leads. When Dickie's father asks Tom to bring his errant playboy son back home to America, Dickie and his beautiful expatriate girlfriend, Marge Sherwood (Gwyneth Paltrow), never suspect the dangerous extremes to which Ripley will go to make their lifestyle his own.

programme.title: Lucy in the Sky
programme.desc: After an awe-inspiring experience in outer space, an astronaut returns to Earth and starts to lose touch with reality in a world that now seems too small.

programme.title: Yesterday
programme.desc: Jack Malik is a struggling singer-songwriter in an English seaside town whose dreams of fame are rapidly fading, despite the fierce devotion and support of his childhood best friend, Ellie. After a freak bus accident during a mysterious global blackout, Jack wakes up to discover that The Beatles have never existed. Performing songs by the greatest band in history to a world that has never heard them Jack becomes on overnight sensation with a little help from his agent.

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, four small-town Michigan boys began a quest to lose their virginity. In the ensuing years, Jim (Jason Biggs) has married Michelle (Alyson Hannigan), though Kevin (Thomas Ian Nicholas) has left Vicky (Tara Reid). Oz (Chris Klein) has grown apart from Heather (Mena Suvari), but Finch still has the hots for Stiffler's (Seann William Scott) mom (Jennifer Coolidge). These lifelong friends have come home to reminisce about -- and become inspired by -- their former teen selves.

programme.title: Tumbledown
programme.desc: A professor (Jason Sudeikis) collaborates with a grieving widow (Rebecca Hall) to write a biography about her husband, a folk singer who attracted a cult following.

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: Born under unusual circumstances, Benjamin Button (Brad Pitt) springs into being as an elderly man in a New Orleans nursing home and ages in reverse. Twelve years after his birth, he meets Daisy, a child who flickers in and out of his life as she grows up to be a dancer (Cate Blanchett). Though he has all sorts of unusual adventures over the course of his life, it is his relationship with Daisy, and the hope that they will come together at the right time, that drives Benjamin forward.

programme.title: Blackhat
programme.desc: After a Hong Kong nuclear plant and the Mercantile Trade Exchange in Chicago are hacked by unknown perpetrators, a federal agent (Viola Davis) proposes that the FBI work with China to find the cyber-criminals. The leader of the Chinese team, Chen Dawai, insists that convicted hacker Nick Hathaway (Chris Hemsworth) be released from prison to help with the investigation. As Nick and his comrades chase their quarry, it becomes evident that the hackers have a sinister motive for their actions.

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, widowed mother Alice Zander (Elizabeth Reaser) unwittingly invites authentic evil into her home by adding a new stunt to bolster her séance scam business. When the merciless spirit overtakes her youngest daughter Doris (Lulu Wilson), the small family must confront unthinkable fears to save her and send her possessor back to the other side.

programme.title: Stuber
programme.desc: A quick-tempered cop who's recovering from eye surgery recruits a mild-mannered Uber driver to help him catch the heroin dealer who murdered his partner. The mismatched pair soon find themselves in for a wild day of stakeouts and shootouts as they pursue violent criminals through the seedy streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Moonlight Mile
programme.desc: When Joe Nast's (Jake Gyllenhaal) plans for marriage change due to an unexpected loss, he wants to be the man he believes everyone wants him to be - dutifully bereaved husband-to-be, and perfect would-be son-in-law to Ben (Dustin Hoffman) and JoJo (Susan Sarandon). But when another woman unexpectedly enters his life, he's quickly torn between fulfilling his new role and following his heart.

programme.title: Duplex
programme.desc: A writer named Alex (Ben Stiller) and his girlfriend, Nancy (Drew Barrymore), move into a spacious duplex in Brooklyn, N.Y. The elderly woman (Eileen Essell) who lives on the building's top floor seems a sweet enough neighbor at first. But pretty soon her constant demands and accidents ruin Alex and Nancy's attempts at having the perfect home. Once they discover that the woman cannot be evicted, they resort to more permanent measures to get rid of her.

programme.title: People Like Us
programme.desc: On the day his latest deal collapses, fast-talking-salesman Sam (Chris Pine) receives the news that his father has died. Reluctantly, Sam returns home to settle the estate of his father. In the course of carrying out the man's last wishes, Sam is surprised to learn of the existence of a 30-year-old sister, named Frankie (Elizabeth Banks). As the sister and brother get to know each other, Sam must re-examine both his perceptions about his family and the life choices that he has made.

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: A teenage hacker finds himself framed for the theft of millions of dollars from a major corporation. Master hacker Dade Murphy, aka Zero Cool, aka Crash Override, has been banned from touching a keyboard for seven years after crashing over 1,500 Wall Street computers at the age of 11. Now keen to get back in front of a monitor, he finds himself in more trouble than ever.

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Complex sociological themes run through this science-fiction classic about three astronauts marooned on a futuristic planet where apes rule and humans are slaves. The stunned trio discovers that these highly intellectual simians can both walk upright and talk. They have even established a class system and a political structure. The astronauts suddenly find themselves part of a devalued species, trapped and imprisoned by the apes.

programme.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: The second installment in "The Planet of the Apes" series. Here, an earthling sent to find the astronauts of the original film discovers not only a world of intelligent, talking apes, but an underground cult of grotesque "humans" who are the survivors of a nuclear blast years ago.

programme.title: Escape From the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In this second sequel to "Planet of the Apes," three apes flee their world before it's destroyed, and travel back in time to present-day America. When the humans discover that the trio are intelligent and capable of speech, they treat them as experimental research animals until they attempt to escape.

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Arthur Dent (Martin Freeman) is trying to prevent his house from being bulldozed when his friend Ford Prefect (Mos Def) whisks him into outer space. It turns out Ford is an alien who has just saved Arthur from Earth's total annihilation. Ford introduces Arthur to his myriad friends, including many-headed President Zaphod Beeblebrox (Sam Rockwell) and sexy refugee Trillian (Zooey Deschanel). Arthur makes his way across the stars while seeking the meaning of life, or something close to it.

programme.title: Darkness
programme.desc: Paul (Stephan Enquist) and his older sister, Regina (Anna Paquin), unpack and settle into their new country home with their mother (Lena Olin) and father (Iain Glen). An atmosphere of dread slowly becomes evident in the house, and, before long, strange things are happening within its walls. As the supernatural occurrences get more intense and threatening, Regina looks into the house's dark history and struggles to uncover the reason behind the macabre presence.

programme.title: The Hoax
programme.desc: In the early 1970s, author Clifford Irving (Richard Gere), with accomplice Richard Suskind (Alfred Molina), attempts to pull off one of the greatest media scams of the century. He writes a fake biography of reclusive billionaire Howard Hughes, claiming that Hughes authorized it, and sells the book to publishing giant McGraw-Hill.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: A defense attorney (Keanu Reeves) tries to get his teenage client (Gabriel Basso) acquitted for the murder of his father (Jim Belushi).

programme.title: Silver City
programme.desc: A campaign manager hires a private detective (Danny Huston) after a Colorado gubernatorial candidate finds a dead body while fishing.

programme.title: Sharky's Machine
programme.desc: An Atlanta vice-squad detective (Burt Reynolds) loves a high-class call girl (Rachel Ward) linked to politics and a mob boss (Vittorio Gassman).

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: When the Event Horizon, a spacecraft that vanished years earlier, suddenly reappears, a team is dispatched to investigate the ship. Accompanied by the Event Horizon's creator, William Weir (Sam Neill), the crew of the Lewis and Clark, led by Capt. Miller (Laurence Fishburne), begins to explore the seemingly abandoned vessel. However, it soon becomes evident that something sinister resides in its corridors, and that the horrors that befell the Event Horizon's previous journey are still present.

programme.title: Ghost in the Machine
programme.desc: After Terry (Karen Allen) tells a computer store clerk where she lives, the information falls into the hands of the clerk's co-worker Karl (Ted Marcoux), the serial murderer known as the "Address Book Killer." When Karl is injured in a car crash, his doctors place him in an MRI machine. As Karl dies, the computer powering the machine extracts his soul. The murderous computer system then locates Terry and tries to kill her by turning technological devices into deadly weapons.

programme.title: View From the Top
programme.desc: A comedy about a young woman from meager beginnings, who has high hopes for the future. Donna (Gwyneth Paltrow) dreams of becoming a first-class international flight attendant and is willing to do whatever it takes to ensure that her dreams come true. The road to success, though, is rarely a smooth flight, and as she begins her trip she encounters more turbulence than even she bargained for.

programme.title: Xanadu
programme.desc: Struggling artist Sonny Malone (Michael Beck) is trapped in a dull job painting album covers. He is instantly attracted to Kira (Olivia Newton-John), an anonymous woman randomly photographed in the background of one of his assignments, but no one is able to identify her. Visiting the auditorium where the cover was shot, Sonny finds the mysterious beauty, an ageless Greek muse, who encourages him to team up with old-fashioned Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly) to build a roller-skating disco.

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris
programme.desc: Steven Russell (Jim Carrey) becomes a cop, gets married and starts a family, but after a terrible car accident, he vows to be true to himself. He comes out of the closet, moves to Florida, and finances a luxurious lifestyle with bad checks and credit cards. In prison, Steven meets Phillip (Ewan McGregor), a mild-mannered inmate who becomes the love of his life. Determined to build a beautiful life with his lover, Steven embarks on another crime spree.

programme.title: Birthday Girl
programme.desc: John (Ben Chaplin) is a mild-mannered banker who has never been lucky in love. Fed up with waiting for the right girl to come along, John takes a chance on a Russian mail-order bride arranged via the Internet. His Internet love connection is the enigmatic Nadia (Nicole Kidman). When Nadia's Russian cousins, Yuri and Alexei, turn up unexpectedly to celebrate her birthday, John's life is turned upside down as he learns the truth behind their relationship and is taken on an adventure.

programme.title: Reds
programme.desc: American journalist John Reed (Warren Beatty) journeys to Russia to document the Boleshevik Revolution and returns a revolutionary. His fervor for left-wing politics leads him to Louise Bryant (Diane Keaton), then married, who will become a feminist icon and activist. Politics at home become more complicated as the rift grows between reality and Reed's ideals. Bryant takes up with a cynical playwright (Jack Nicholson), and Reed returns to Russia, where his health declines.

programme.title: La La Land
programme.desc: Sebastian (Ryan Gosling) and Mia (Emma Stone) are drawn together by their common desire to do what they love. But as success mounts they are faced with decisions that begin to fray the fragile fabric of their love affair, and the dreams they worked so hard to maintain in each other threaten to rip them apart.

programme.title: Munich
programme.desc: After the murder of 11 Israeli athletes and their coach at the 1972 Olympics, the Israeli government secretly assigns Avner Kaufman (Eric Bana) to carry out a series of strategic retaliations. With the help of a driver (Daniel Craig), a forger (Hanns Zischler), a bomb-maker (Mathieu Kassovitz) and a former soldier (Ciarán Hinds), Avner conducts a worldwide operation, targeting 11 individuals. As the assassinations pile up, Avner begins to doubt the morality of his actions.

programme.title: Sophie's Choice
programme.desc: Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a young writer, moves to Brooklyn in 1947 to begin work on his first novel. As he becomes friendly with Sophie (Meryl Streep) and her lover Nathan (Kevin Kline), he learns that Sophie is a Holocaust survivor. Flashbacks reveal her harrowing story, from pre-war prosperity to Auschwitz. In the present, Sophie and Nathan's relationship increasingly unravels as Stingo grows closer to Sophie and Nathan's fragile mental state becomes ever more apparent.

programme.title: The Punisher
programme.desc: This dark action film, based on the comic book series, follows FBI agent Frank Castle (Thomas Jane) as he transforms into the vengeful Punisher after criminals murder his family, including his wife and son. Castle is gravely injured in the attack and believed to be dead by Howard Saint (John Travolta), the crime lord who ordered the hit. Following his recovery, Castle becomes a heavily armed vigilante who will stop at nothing to exact revenge on Saint and dismantle his underworld empire.

programme.title: Brubaker
programme.desc: Posing as an inmate at a small Arkansas prison, the new warden of the penitentiary, Henry Brubaker (Robert Redford), witnesses firsthand the corruption and abuse inflicted upon the prisoners by the staff. After revealing his true identity, Brubaker brings much-needed reform to the prison with the help of supporters Dickie Coombes (Yaphet Kotto) and Lillian Gray (Jane Alexander). Yet when the benefactors of the old corrupt system are threatened by the changes, Brubaker's battles really begin.

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Complex sociological themes run through this science-fiction classic about three astronauts marooned on a futuristic planet where apes rule and humans are slaves. The stunned trio discovers that these highly intellectual simians can both walk upright and talk. They have even established a class system and a political structure. The astronauts suddenly find themselves part of a devalued species, trapped and imprisoned by the apes.

programme.title: The Pope of Greenwich Village
programme.desc: Cousins Paulie (Eric Roberts) and Charlie (Mickey Rourke) plan to rob a merchant in the New York City neighborhood that's home to the restaurant where they work. When their scheme results in the death of a police officer and draws the ire of the Mafia-linked businessman who was ripped off, Charlie's girlfriend (Daryl Hannah) bolts, and mob henchmen exact a brutal price from Paulie. With the mob threatening to kill them, the thieves must think fast if they intend to survive.

programme.title: Dead Again
programme.desc: When a mute woman suffering from amnesia (Emma Thompson) arrives at the gates of an old orphanage, private investigator Mike Church (Kenneth Branagh) is asked to find out who she is. With the help of a hypnotist (Derek Jacobi), the woman regains her voice and recalls vivid past memories of a couple from the 1940s torn apart by murder. Church begins to develop feelings for the woman, who he calls Grace, and then discovers he has a connection to the tragic couple from the 40s.

programme.title: The Wings of the Dove
programme.desc: Kate (Helena Bonham Carter) is secretly betrothed to a struggling journalist, Merton Densher (Linus Roache). But she knows her Aunt Maude (Charlotte Rampling) will never approve of the match, since Kate's deceased mother has lost all her money in a marriage to a degenerate opium addict (Michael Gambon). When Kate meets a terminally ill American heiress named Millie (Alison Elliott) traveling through Europe, she comes up with a conniving plan to have both love and wealth.

programme.title: A Price Above Rubies
programme.desc: Sonia (Renée Zellweger) is a married Hasidic woman in Brooklyn, N.Y., whose husband, Mendel (Glenn Fitzgerald), is inattentive. She begins having an affair with Mendel's brother, Sender (Christopher Eccleston), who allows her to work in his jewelry business. There, she meets a Puerto Rican artist and designer named Ramon (Allen Payne), with whom she finds a strong connection. When Sender learns of her affection for Ramon, he sets out to ostracize her from her husband and family.

programme.title: Anna to the Infinite Power
programme.desc: A child prodigy (Martha Byrne) learns she is part of a secret experiment in genetic engineering.

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Arthur Dent (Martin Freeman) is trying to prevent his house from being bulldozed when his friend Ford Prefect (Mos Def) whisks him into outer space. It turns out Ford is an alien who has just saved Arthur from Earth's total annihilation. Ford introduces Arthur to his myriad friends, including many-headed President Zaphod Beeblebrox (Sam Rockwell) and sexy refugee Trillian (Zooey Deschanel). Arthur makes his way across the stars while seeking the meaning of life, or something close to it.

programme.title: Journey 2: The Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Now 17, Sean Anderson (Josh Hutcherson) receives a coded distress signal from an island where none should exist. Knowing that he will not be able to dissuade Sean from tracking the signal to its source, Hank (Dwayne Johnson), Sean's new stepfather, joins the teen on a quest to the South Pacific. Together with helicopter pilot Gabato (Luis Guzmán) and Gabato's feisty daughter, Kailani (Vanessa Hudgens), they set out to find the island and rescue its sole human inhabitant (Michael Caine).

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: CIA operatives FDR Foster (Chris Pine) and Tuck (Tom Hardy) are inseparable best friends and partners. Together, their good looks, covert abilities and combat skills rank them among the CIA's elite, but their longstanding personal and professional bond is put to the test when they meet Lauren (Reese Witherspoon). FDR and Tuck both fall hard for the beautiful blonde, turning their deadly skills and an array of high-tech gadgetry against each other in an all-out battle for her love.

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: Steve (Matthew Broderick), suburban dad and Christmas enthusiast, finds a wrinkle in his well-ordered existence with the arrival of his new neighbor Danny (Danny DeVito). Danny has big dreams and plans to illuminate his house with enough holiday lights to make it visible from space. Not to be outdone, Steve declares a war of one-upmanship with Danny that threatens to drag the Christmas spirit through the slush.

programme.title: Duplex
programme.desc: A writer named Alex (Ben Stiller) and his girlfriend, Nancy (Drew Barrymore), move into a spacious duplex in Brooklyn, N.Y. The elderly woman (Eileen Essell) who lives on the building's top floor seems a sweet enough neighbor at first. But pretty soon her constant demands and accidents ruin Alex and Nancy's attempts at having the perfect home. Once they discover that the woman cannot be evicted, they resort to more permanent measures to get rid of her.

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: When Cindy (Elaine Bromka) and her husband, Bob (Garrett M. Brown), have to leave town for a family emergency, there is only one person available to babysit for their three kids: Bob's lazy, carefree brother, Buck (John Candy). While he immediately gets along with the two younger children (Gaby Hoffman, Macaulay Culkin), Buck must change his bachelor lifestyle if he wants to be a responsible caregiver for the angst-filled teenager, Tia (Jean Louisa Kelly).

programme.title: Almost Heroes
programme.desc: Two explorers are racing Lewis and Clark to the Pacific Ocean in 1804. Edwards (Matthew Perry) is a glory-seeking fop who's out of his league, Hunt (Chris Farley) is a slovenly, clumsy tracker with a soft spot for toilet humor. Along with a team of misfits and losers, the duo wreaks havoc on the American frontier.

programme.title: Lawnmower Man 2: Jobe's War
programme.desc: Jobe (Matt Frewer) exists as a malevolent consciousness in virtual reality and seeks to discover the technology to hack into all the world's computers. Jobe contacts Peter (Austin O'Brien), who had been a friend during his corporeal existence, to assist him, but the young man realizes Jobe's evil intent. Peter calls on Benjamin (Patrick Bergin), a brilliant computer engineer, to help thwart Jobe's scheme for world domination, and a battle rages throughout cyberspace and in the real world.

programme.title: The Woman in Red
programme.desc: When a happily married family man, who would never consider an affair, meets a beautiful woman in red, he is totally infatuated and desperate to make her acquaintance. However, as he tries out various schemes to sneak out to meet her, he realizes that adultery is not quite as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: "Battle for the Planet of the Apes" is the final chapter in the sci-fi movie series. In this chapter, a tribute of human atomic bomb mutations are out to make life miserable for the peaceful ape tribe. The story is told primarily in flashback with the opening and closing taking place in the year 2670.

programme.title: An Ideal Husband
programme.desc: Sir Robert Chiltern (Jeremy Northam) is a respected government official and a loving husband. His friend, Lord Arthur Goring (Rupert Everett), is a notorious womanizer who lives a life of casual lounging, meaningless flirtations and multiple illicit affairs. But when old acquaintance Laura Cheveley (Julianne Moore) arrives in London to stir up trouble, the lives of the two men become increasingly complicated and intertwined, and their true natures are revealed.

programme.title: Get Over It
programme.desc: A comic look at a romantic problem that has plagued mankind since the very first boy-girl breakup: how's a guy supposed to survive in a world where ex-girlfriends continue to exist ... and attract? When Berke (Ben Foster) and Allison (Melissa Sagemiller) break up he has a hard time dealing with her dating the new hot guy in school.

programme.title: The Good Lie
programme.desc: After their village is destroyed and their parents killed by Northern militia, Sudanese orphans Theo, his siblings and other survivors make a difficult journey to a refugee camp in Kenya. Thirteen years later, the group gets the chance to settle in the U.S. They are met in Kansas by Carrie Davis (Reese Witherspoon), who has been charged with finding them jobs. However, seeing how adrift they are in 20th-century America, Carrie endeavors to help them in rebuilding their shattered lives.

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris
programme.desc: Steven Russell (Jim Carrey) becomes a cop, gets married and starts a family, but after a terrible car accident, he vows to be true to himself. He comes out of the closet, moves to Florida, and finances a luxurious lifestyle with bad checks and credit cards. In prison, Steven meets Phillip (Ewan McGregor), a mild-mannered inmate who becomes the love of his life. Determined to build a beautiful life with his lover, Steven embarks on another crime spree.

programme.title: Idlewild
programme.desc: A reticent piano player, named Percival (André Benjamin), along with Rooster (Antwan A. Patton), his flamboyant lead performer and manager, struggle to keep their speakeasy, in the Prohibition-era South, out of the hands of gangsters who want to take it over.

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story
programme.desc: Despondent after breaking up with his girlfriend, Zia (Patrick Fugit) kills himself and wakes up in a bland purgatory populated by other suicides. He takes a job at Kamikaze Pizza and befriends a Russian rocker named Eugene (Shea Whigham) while trying to make the best of a very dull afterlife. Learning that his ex-girlfriend has also killed herself, Zia embarks on a road trip with Eugene to find her, picking up a feisty hitchhiker (Shannyn Sossamon) along the way.

programme.title: Human Capital
programme.desc: The lives of two families collide when their children begin a relationship and it leads to a tragic accident.

programme.title: Deep Cover
programme.desc: David Jason (Jeff Goldblum) is the biggest drug dealer in Los Angeles, and Russell Stevens (Larry Fishburne) is an undercover cop who wants to bring him down. Posing as a dealer, Stevens begins to earn the trust of the L.A. drug underworld, eventually making his way to Jason himself. But along the way he has to take his cover to depths he never thought he would have to see, including selling drugs and going to great lengths to eliminate potential competitors for Jason's drug cartel.

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: Charged with the most important assignment of his career, federal agent Ron Fleury (Jamie Foxx) has one week to assemble a team, infiltrate and destroy a terrorist cell based in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Culture shock and opposition from local law enforcement combine to hinder his progress and that of his elite team (Chris Cooper, Jennifer Garner, Jason Bateman), but a sympathetic Saudi police captain becomes an unexpected comrade-in-arms.

programme.title: In Secret
programme.desc: A woman (Elizabeth Olsen) and her lover (Oscar Isaac) conspire to murder her mild-mannered husband (Tom Felton), but overwhelming guilt soon turns their passion into hatred.

programme.title: The Good Liar
programme.desc: Career con artist Roy Courtnay can hardly believe his luck when he meets well-to-do widow Betty McLeish online. As Betty opens her life and home to him, Roy is surprised to find himself caring about her, turning what should be a cut-and-dry swindle into the most treacherous tightrope walk of his life.

programme.title: Welcome to Sarajevo
programme.desc: Michael Henderson (Stephen Dillane) is a reporter covering the war in Sarajevo, Bosnia-Herzegovina. He develops a competitive friendship with Flynn (Woody Harrelson), an arrogant TV reporter, as they cover the chaos and suffering occurring around them. When Henderson reports on a dilapidated orphanage, he becomes affected by the plight of its occupants. With the help of an American aid worker named Nina (Marisa Tomei), Henderson tries to find a way to smuggle the children out of the country.

programme.title: Project X
programme.desc: As punishment for a minor offense, the Air Force assigns pilot Jimmy Garrett (Matthew Broderick) to watch over a group of chimpanzees used for military experiments. Jimmy bonds with Virgil, a chimp capable of communicating with sign language. But when he witnesses the military's plan to kill the animals with radiation, Jimmy enlists the help of Teri MacDonald (Helen Hunt), the graduate student responsible for teaching sign language to Virgil, to free the chimps.

programme.title: Sophie's Choice
programme.desc: Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a young writer, moves to Brooklyn in 1947 to begin work on his first novel. As he becomes friendly with Sophie (Meryl Streep) and her lover Nathan (Kevin Kline), he learns that Sophie is a Holocaust survivor. Flashbacks reveal her harrowing story, from pre-war prosperity to Auschwitz. In the present, Sophie and Nathan's relationship increasingly unravels as Stingo grows closer to Sophie and Nathan's fragile mental state becomes ever more apparent.

programme.title: In Good Company
programme.desc: After years of working as an ad executive at a sports magazine, Dan Foreman (Dennis Quaid) is demoted and replaced with Carter Duryea (Topher Grace), a rising star in the business world who is young enough to be Dan's son. Carter's business style leaves Dan shaking his head and wondering if the young man is ready for the corporate world. Dan's life is further complicated when he learns his wife is pregnant and Carter is dating his daughter, Alex (Scarlett Johansson).

programme.title: Phantoms
programme.desc: The resort town of Snowfield, Colo., is under attack by an evil spirit that almost wipes out the entire population, possessing a number of those it kills. As the locals continue to fall victim to the demonic presence, it's up to Sheriff Bryce Hammond (Ben Affleck) to lead the response. He's helped by FBI-employed academic Dr. Timothy Flyte (Peter O'Toole), Deputy Stu Wargle (Liev Schreiber), local doctor Jennifer Pailey (Joanna Going) and her visiting sister, Lisa (Rose McGowan).

programme.title: Fame
programme.desc: At New York's High School of Performing Arts, students (Asher Book, Kristy Flores, Paul Iacono) from all walks of life get the chance to hone their skills as singers, actors, dancers and more. Over four years, these young men and women will see if they truly have the dedication and talent to achieve success, while still juggling regular schoolwork, feelings of self-doubt and budding romances.

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Following the assassination of President Lincoln, seven men and one woman are arrested and charged with conspiring to kill Lincoln, the vice president and the secretary of state. Lawyer Frederick Aiken (James McAvoy) reluctantly agrees to defend the lone woman, Mary Surratt (Robin Wright), who owns a boarding house where John Wilkes Booth and others met to plan their crimes. Aiken realizes that Mary may be innocent and being used as bait to capture her son, a suspect who is still at large.

programme.title: Can You Keep a Secret?
programme.desc: A young woman spills all of her secrets to a stranger on a plane when she thinks it's about to crash. She later meets the man and discovers he is her company's new CEO, and he knows all of her humiliating secrets.

programme.title: Much Ado About Nothing
programme.desc: After a successful campaign against his rebellious brother, Don John (Sean Maher), Don Pedro (Reed Diamond) visits the governor of Messina. With him are Benedick (Alexis Denisof) and Claudio (Fran Kranz). While there, Claudio falls for the governor's daughter, Hero (Jillian Morgese), while Benedick engages in a war of words with Beatrice (Amy Acker), the governor's niece. While Don Pedro tries to trick Benedick and Beatrice into falling in love, Don John tries to tear Claudio and Hero apart.

programme.title: The Challenge
programme.desc: The remaining eight agents arrive at TJ's final and begin their most grueling mission of the season; one team's fate hangs in the balance after a shocking revelation.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo welcome music sensation Lauv to talk about "Fighting Modern Loneliness," kids who are "Running Up the Bill" and people who are doing nothing but "Making It Worse" in a relationship.

programme.desc: Model Danielle Herrington joins Rob, Steelo and Chanel to teach the gang what it takes to be "Cover Ready" and check out cutting edge fashion in "NY Looks."

programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo experience going bald in "Hairlos," have delayed reactions in "Sloth-Like Reflexes," and learn that pain just keeps coming in "When it Pains, it Pours."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: UFC star and MMA champ Paige VanZant joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to celebrate some "First-Time Fighters" and order takeout with some "Chef Messes."

programme.desc: Sterling and Chanel; "Rubber Stamped"; "Blenders"; "Truth Bombs."

programme.desc: Chris "Drama" Pfaff joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to visit the library in "Check This Out," find out who's "Still Bladin'," and help some people with their "Game Rabies."

programme.desc: Baddie Winkle; "Fountain of Baddie."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo test some harebrained plans in "Can't Believe That Worked," stumble over some words in "Vernacular Manslaughter," and hone pee skills in "Stream Kings."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Olympic gold medalist Kaitlyn Farrington; "Other Sochi Games"; "Pokeaphobia"; "Virgin Larper."

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Angela Kinsey, Kel Mitchell and Tim Chantarangsu join Tiffani Thiessen to talk about bananas, aka "Fruitdogs," mornings ruined by "Coff Drops" and the art of sneaking "Undercover Snacks."

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Angela Kinsey, Kel Mitchell and Tim Chantarangsu join Tiffani Thiessen to talk about the "Hardest Job in America" and celebrate round guts with "Behold the Belly."

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Angela Kinsey, Kel Mitchell and Tim Chantarangsu join Tiffani Thiessen to talk about heinous "Crimes Against Pizza," their obsession with "Brunch Punch" and foods that you have to "Eat at Your Own Risk."

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Angela Kinsey, Kel Mitchell and Tim Chantarangsu join Tiffani Thiessen to talk about their "Hanger Issues," getting separate checks on "Last Dates" and to celebrate nature's fart pill: "BEEEEEAAAANS!"

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Angela Kinsey, Kel Mitchell and Tim Chantarangsu join Tiffani Thiessen to talk about kids having their "First Tastes," drinking "Five Too Many" and the joy that only "The Happy Truck" can bring.

programme.title: Deliciousness
programme.desc: Chantarangsu joins Tiffani Thiessen to talk about their "Happiest Meals," finding "Hate at First Bite," and committing "Wine-Nos."

programme.title: She's All That
programme.desc: High school hotshot Zach Siler (Freddie Prinze Jr.) is the envy of his peers. But his popularity declines sharply when his cheerleader girlfriend, Taylor (Jodi Lyn O'Keefe), leaves him for sleazy reality-television star Brock Hudson (Matthew Lillard). Desperate to revive his fading reputation, Siler agrees to a seemingly impossible challenge. He has six weeks to gain the trust of nerdy outcast Laney Boggs (Rachael Leigh Cook) -- and help her to become the school's next prom queen.

programme.title: Easy A
programme.desc: Prompted by her popular best friend to spill details of her boring weekend, Olive (Emma Stone), a clean-cut teen, decides to spice things up by telling a little lie about losing her virginity. When the high-school busybody (Amanda Bynes) overhears the conversation and spreads it all over campus, Olive is suddenly notorious but for the wrong reasons.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Country music singer Kane Brown joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to talk about "True Horror," when dream trucks become "Shattered Dream Trucks" and take a look at some "Failed Experiments."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo celebrate some people who are "Large and in Charge," witness some "Teacher Trials," and find out if guys have more fun when they're "Hawaiian Stylin'."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Comic Brooks Wheelan; "Drunk on eBay"; "Critter Control"; "Snake Bait."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo share some laughs with the Lord in "God Pranks," go on an adventure with "Fort Wayne Jones" and mind their manners in "Extremely Courteous."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Comic Rob Riggle joins Rob, Steelo, and Chanel as they visit a "Ski Disaster Academy," celebrate some "North American Turds" and report the news while"Live on the Scene."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel and Steelo support some ladies in "Yas Girl," play some "High Stakes Games" and try and catch some "Baby Evaders."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Podcast hosts Bryan Callen and Brendan Schaub; "Fighters and Funny People."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Rob, Chanel, and Steelo are joined by actor Lamorne Morris.

programme.title: Floribama Shore
programme.desc: As Club Basement winds down, Ally makes a move toward one of the guys. Codi enlists his roommates to recreate a moment of family lore. Kirk sweeps and cleans (and prays for everyone's best behavior) in preparation for his girlfriend Wren's first-ever visit to the vacation house. But his hopes for a peaceful time are dashed when family dinner blows up in unavoidable fashion.

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Actress Karrueche Tran joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to find out "The Salon Gets Serious"; get "Life Sync'd"; watch some suspenseful "Cliphangers."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Breakaways; Anything But Walking; Life Sync'd.

programme.desc: Metta World Peace; "Metta Ball"; "Here for the Discount."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: TV host Nev Schulman joins Rob, Chanel and Steelo to meet some fake celebs in "Faux Famous"; bask in epic chest hair in "Chest Blessed."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Sterling and Chanel; "Competitive Sleeping"; "Creature Shock"; "Sunday Doneday."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: Sara Jean Underwood visit the set; "Fear Face"; "Cats Are Weird."

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Grown Ups
programme.desc: The death of their childhood basketball coach leads to a reunion for some old friends (Adam Sandler, Kevin James, Chris Rock), who gather at the site of a championship celebration years earlier. Picking up where they left off, the buddies -- with wives and children in tow -- discover why age does not, necessarily, equal maturity.

programme.title: Grown Ups 2
programme.desc: Lenny Feder (Adam Sandler) moves his family back to his hometown to be with his friends, but he finds -- what with old bullies, new bullies, party crashers and more -- that he hasn't left the crazy life behind in Los Angeles. Lenny's friends must also cope with their own challenges: Eric (Kevin James) must face his ultimate fear; Kurt (Chris Rock) has gone back to work as a cable repairman; and Marcus (David Spade) learns that he has an 18-year-old son.

programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
programme.desc: Chuck Levine (Adam Sandler) and Larry Valentine (Kevin James) are firefighters and true-blue buddies. When Larry, a widower, learns he cannot name his children as beneficiaries on his life insurance policy, he needs a big favor from Chuck: Sign on as Larry's domestic partner. The pals unexpectedly become front-page news and must carry the masquerade to extremes when an overzealous bureaucrat becomes suspicious of their true relationship.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: Las cimas nevadas de las Cascadas Altas ocultan los volcanes más activos en el Bajo 48. Los zorros prosperan en sus laderas, las ranas de cola se aparean en los arroyos rocosos, y las martas de pino cazan en los bosques alpinos.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: Los árboles más altos del mundo en la costa de California.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: Los peligrosos picos del oeste de Montana ocultan un antiguo secreto: el territorio glaciar americano. Una tierra de valles esculpidos en hielo, laderas escarpadas y lagos ocultos, poblada por cabras montesas, mirlos acuáticos y osos.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: La vida se abre camino entre el desierto caluroso y la cima más alta en una historia de dos extremos.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: Las ondulantes llanuras de la franja de Texas son más que ganado y vaqueros, también es tierra de garras, espinas y colmillos.

programme.title: Wild: Estados Unidos
programme.desc: El secreto más bello de Texas se oculta a lo largo de la frontera, donde el Río Grande se encuentra con las montañas: el parque nacional Big Bend. Este paraíso desértico hace mucho tiempo que viene prosperando, oculto hasta ahora.

programme.title: Noche de pelea animal
programme.desc: En un enfrentamiento de peso pesado entre dos bestias voluminosas, un cuerno se enfrenta a dos cuando un rinoceronte y un búfalo se vuelven brutales en el campo de batalla.

programme.title: Noche de pelea animal
programme.desc: En la sabana africana, el temperamento de los elefantes machos estalla cuando el agua escasea. Véalos ir de colmillo a colmillo y trompa a trompa cuando ellos se enfrentan.

programme.title: Noche de pelea animal
programme.desc: Peleas y reyertas del reino animal a través del globo.

programme.title: Noche de pelea animal
programme.desc: Una lucha a muerte entre varias leonas y un leopardo; luchan dos osos pardos por un lugar privilegiado para la pesca del salmón en Alasca. En el desiero de Sahara, un tejón enfrenta a dos chacales para proteger a su familia.

programme.desc: Programa que muestra diversos productos para la venta.

programme.title: ¡Revitaliza Tus Piernas y Pies!
programme.desc: ¡PowerLegs Te Da un Masaje de Pies y Piernas Relajante y Refrescante en Casa!

programme.title: Rotorazor: La sierra más larga
programme.desc: El nuevo profesional Rotorazer es una forma rápida y eficaz para realizar cortes de precisión en tan sólo unos segundos.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: La lucha de Hitler por los cielos obliga al Reich a adoptar una política de Guerra Total. El resultado es uno de los sistemas de defensa aérea más eficientes que el mundo haya visto.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: En mayo de 1940, la maquinaria de guerra nazi llega al canal de la Mancha. Hitler planea destruir la fuerza aérea británica y llevar tropas al sur de Inglaterra.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Guadalcanal es la perla del Pacífico y Japón está decidido a construir un campo de aviación allí. Sin embargo, EE. UU. también está interesado en él. El país que controle Guadalcanal ganará potencialmente la Segunda Guerra Mundial.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: En 1942, Japón invadió Birmania y ordenó la construcción de un ferrocarril para garantizar la llegada de suministros. La obra empleó a 200 000 prisioneros de guerra, a los que se obligó a montar una vía de 415 kilómetros de longitud.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, Adolf Hitler encomendó al general Erwin Rommel derrotar a los Aliados en Túnez, Libia y Egipto. Las duras condiciones del terreno y el genio militar de Rommel pusieron a los británicos al límite de su resistencia.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial, un grupo de espías de los Aliados pusieron documentos falsos junto a un cadáver. Esto logró que la invasión de Sicilia sorprendiera a las fuerzas nazis.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis: La guerra rusa
programme.desc: La historia de cómo Hitler invadió Rusia, de la mayor fuerza invasora jamás reunida en la historia militar y de la historia menos conocida del asedio de Sebastopol, en el Mar Negro.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis: La guerra rusa
programme.desc: Tras una humillante derrota en Stalingrado, Adolf Hitler decide llevar a cabo una Guerra Total antes de dar comienzo a la mayor batalla de tanques de la historia.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis: La guerra rusa
programme.desc: La historia de la retirada nazi del Báltico al corazón de Berlín.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Las vías férreas fueron el alma y la sangre del imperio de la Alemania nazi, empleadas para difundir la ambición y poder. Este programa revelará el tren personal de Hitler, búnkeres jamás vistos, y el papel siniestro de los trenes nazis.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Los Aliados pensaron que un avance desde el sur podría derrotar a los nazis, pero se equivocaron. Descubrir la estrategia que llevó a Hitler a desplegar una línea defensiva por toda la península italiana.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Este show destapa la guerra de Hitler, mientras presenta la Luftwaffe, una revolucionaria fuerza aérea alemana, creada a partir de la nada y apresurada por Hitler para aniquilar al enemigo desde el cielo.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Hitler y la maquinaria de propaganda fueron clave en el lavado de cerebro de una nación. Este episodio investigará la evidencia dejada por los nazis, liderados por el genio siniestro del control mental: el Dr. Joseph Goebbels.

programme.title: Megaestructuras Nazis
programme.desc: Una de las operaciones más riesgosas y atrevidas de la Segunda Guerra Mundial: la ocupación nazi y la fortificación en Noruega. Los hechos y motivos que desencadenaron la invasión a este frente ártico.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Tras las batallas mortales que ahora amenazan con poner al bombardero B-29 de los EE. UU. al alcance de Japón, una poderosa arma podría llevarlos a la victoria.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Una mirada al sistema de defensa sin precedentes de Japón en Peleliu, que creó una zona de muerte y produjo la pérdida de miles de vidas de soldados estadounidenses.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Un vistazo a los últimos meses de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, cuando Japón envía terroristas suicidas mientras convierte sus islas en una fortaleza para ahuyentar a los invasores estadounidenses.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Una mirada a la preparación secreta y la tecnología de torpedos que se utilizó en el devastador ataque aéreo de Japón contra la flota estadounidense del Pacífico en 1941.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Una mirada al intento final de Hitler de ganar la guerra con un ataque sorpresa durante el invierno, y los crímenes de guerra resultantes contra las fuerzas estadounidenses.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Los alemanes esperan un ataque en la primavera de 1944 por parte de los Aliados, pero, en lugar de eso, se produce un fascinante juego del gato y el ratón hasta que llega el día 6 de junio de 1944.

programme.title: Megaestructuras nazis
programme.desc: Tras las batallas mortales que ahora amenazan con poner al bombardero B-29 de los EE. UU. al alcance de Japón, una poderosa arma podría llevarlos a la victoria.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: El viaje comienza en Tokio, donde la convivencia de culturas milenarias con una moda futurista hace que parezca una ciudad abarrotada de solitarios.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: La aventura continúa en China y el punto de partida es Beijing. Aunque es un país que crece sin pausa, China conserva una historia milenaria.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: En Vietnam, el equipo inicia un viaje que los llevará a los valles del norte. Cruzarán la frontera para recorrer los paisajes de Laos y se adentrarán en la selva en busca de comunidades humanas que la habitan.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: El equipo comienza esta etapa en Angkor, la ciudad sagrada de los jemeres, en Camboya. En Tailandia visitarán Bangkok y conocerán mercados insólitos y templos sombríos.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Un viaje por el centro histórico de los pueblos de América y la importancia que tenía el universo para los habitantes de aquella época. Se explora la conexión de las más antiguas civilizaciones con las estrellas y el cielo.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Se exploran episodios cósmicos como las auroras boreales, creadas por el sol en los extremos del planeta. Se muestra un antiguo templo construido para marcar el paso de la luz en diferentes épocas del año.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Visita a una base espacial en el desierto estadounidense donde personas de todo el mundo se preparan para la conquista del planeta rojo, Marte.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Se flota como los astronautas en el espacio y se descubren los increíbles telescopios que apuntan a los confines del universo.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Un viaje a las entrañas de la tierra para entender cómo se originó la vida y la gran diversidad de especies que habitan la Tierra.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Se descubre qué pasó hace miles de años atrás en el planeta Tierra y se conoce lo que dice la ciencia sobre el tiempo.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: Llegó la hora de dar el salto a Indonesia. Se cruzarán las selvas de Sumatra antes de viajar a Borneo y se buceará entre tortugas y medusas en las aldeas remotas.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: La aventura sigue en la isla de Mataking. Allí se visitan las casas flotantes de los bajau, los gitanos del mar; el mercado de Manila y las terrazas de arroz esculpidas por los ifugao al norte de Filipinas.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: Tras la larga travesía por el Mar de Banda, la expedición llega al archipiélago de Raja Ampat, el destino soñado por los buceadores.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: Sidney es el punto de partida para recorrer el país. Se atravesarán ciclones y conocerán playas. Además, se visitará el Parque Nacional Kakadu, santuario de la tradición rupestre más longeva del mundo y una extraña ciudad: Coober Pedy, la capital del ópalo.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: El equipo recorre las playas de Fiji. Allí, vivirán la aventura de sus ríos salvajes y descubrirán los tesoros de la Melanesia.

programme.title: Pacífico
programme.desc: La experiencia por el Pacífico se está acabando y para despedirse han trazado una ruta muy especial: seguir el rastro de los maoríes. Desde Islas Cook y sus playas, viajaran a uno de los países más fascinantes: Nueva Zelanda.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: La misión de la Nasa para encontrar vida extraterrestre. El gran misterio que dejó la cultura ancestral de Perú sobre la vida en otros mundos. Los avances astronómicos para llevar la mirada a otros planetas.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Los lugares donde están los dinosaurios más antiguos de América. Se sigue a un equipo internacional de investigadores que buscan fósiles en un misterioso lugar de Punta Arenas. Las consecuencias que podría originar una tormenta solar.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Se analiza la importancia del agua, y la crisis que enfrenta el planeta como consecuencia. También se estudian las nociones precolombinas de este elemento.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: ¿Qué sonidos llegan hasta acá? ¿Qué mensajes ocultan? Para descubrirlo, se viaja a Chile a presenciar el proyecto Concierto cielos, una combinación de música, apoyo social y ciencia en Pudahuel, una de las comunas más vulnerables del país.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Un viaje a las entrañas de la tierra para entender cómo se originó la vida y la gran diversidad de especies que habitan la Tierra.

programme.title: Maravillas del universo
programme.desc: Se descubre qué pasó hace miles de años atrás en el planeta Tierra y se conoce lo que dice la ciencia sobre el tiempo.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: La división de estupefacientes perfila a tres jóvenes que llegan desde Paraguay para visitar familia, pero su relato no les parece creíble.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: Un joven peruano que viaja a Madrid por turismo lleva en su equipaje una pequeña cantidad de café que, en realidad, podría ser la tapadera de un contrabando de sustancias ilícitas.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: Un ciudadano español recién llegado de Colombia es apartado por los oficiales de estupefacientes para un control más exhaustivo luego de un entrevista de rutina.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: Un colombiano causa sospechas ya que solo tiene como equipaje un estuche de instrumento musical y, aunque todo parece normal, cuando los agentes indagan, descubren que el joven no tiene talento para tocar el instrumento.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: La policía queda estupefacta cuando revisa el equipaje de una pareja, dando lugar a uno de los casos más extraños con el que jamás se hayan topado. Después, los agentes interrogan a dos pasajeros muy particulares.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: Un vuelo proveniente de Marruecos es monitoreado por el cuerpo de estupefacientes de la Policía Nacional y la particular reacción de un hombre frente a los oficiales deriva en la revisión de sus maletas y una gran sorpresa por lo que esta revela.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: Un hombre que dice estar en camino a una reunión mayor es separado para una revisión por la división de estupefacientes. Todo indica que se tratará de una mera formalidad, pero las apariencias engañan y se descubren desafortunadas sorpresas.

programme.title: Alerta Aeropuerto: Madrid
programme.desc: En la llegada de un vuelo procedente de Bogotá, la División de Estupefacientes sospecha de un joven cuyo equipaje de mano resulta poco convencional.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: Lima
programme.desc: La policía deberá develar los verdaderos motivos para volar a Europa de dos pasajeros y atender el insistente pedido de una turista para que examinen su equipaje, mientras que una empleada tendrá que pedir ayuda por un exótico pasajero.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: Lima
programme.desc: Gracias a los rayos X, los agentes detectan anomalías en una maleta destinada a un vuelo que está a punto de despegar. Mientras tanto, el calor pone en evidencia a dos pasajeros y deberán rendir explicaciones ante la policía antidrogas.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: Lima
programme.desc: Los agentes deben interceptar a tres pasajeros sospechosos antes de que embarquen hacia el viejo continente mientras descubren qué esconde una mujer que intenta viajar a Madrid con una maleta que, asegura, ha sido adulterada.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: Lima
programme.desc: Los rayos X que controlan los equipajes alertan a la policía sobre tres maletas que pronto viajarán a España con contenidos sospechosos. Mientras tanto, los agentes antidrogas revisan a dos pasajeros que se han mostrado nerviosos en las filas.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: San Pablo
programme.desc: La policía antidrogas debe descubrir qué es lo que llevan oculto dos mujeres que intentan salir del país con objetos sospechosos adosados a su cuerpo, mientras que los agentes migratorios deben desemascarar insólitas excusas.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: San Pablo
programme.desc: El equipo de inteligencia de la Policia Federal ha detectado a dos pasajeros que podrían estar viajando con drogas, pero gracias a la labor de los oficiales, logran interceptar a cuatro sospechosos.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: San Pablo
programme.desc: La policia antidrogas logra burlar el envío de más de 35 kilos de cocaína con destino al continente africano, mientras los agentes aduaneros intentan descubrir qué hay detrás del extraño viaje de una mujer embarazada.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: San Pablo
programme.desc: Los agentes antidrogas deben revelar si una pareja de supuestos recién casados es tan inocente como parece. Mientras tanto, otros tres pasajeros tratan de viajar a África.

programme.title: Alerta aeropuerto: Lima
programme.desc: La policía deberá develar los verdaderos motivos para volar a Europa de dos pasajeros y atender el insistente pedido de una turista para que examinen su equipaje, mientras que una empleada tendrá que pedir ayuda por un exótico pasajero.
